channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Chinese Nationalists Praise Trump’s Cuts to Voice of America
item.description: Beijing has long criticized the outlet, as well as Radio Free Asia, for highlighting human rights abuses in China.

item.title: Top psychologist Adam Grant says it’s not on women to close the pay gap—It’s time for employers to step up
item.description: Only 36% of women feel comfortable asking for a raise, according to new data from Glassdoor.

item.title: Blockchain payments company Halliday raises $20 million from Andreessen Horowitz
item.description: The company will use the money to accelerate the launch of their flagship product.

item.title: Wiz founders’ bold bet: Rejecting Google’s original offer leads to $32 billion buyout deal—and $9 billion in extra cash
item.description: If closed, the-cash Wiz transaction will become Google’s most expensive acquisition in the company’s 25-year history.

item.title: Clean technology will prevail despite policy uncertainty today—so deploy, baby, deploy
item.description: Over three-quarters of CFOs are increasing or maintaining sustainability investments in 2025.

item.title: Google Seals $32 Billion Deal for Cyber Start-Up Wiz
item.description: The acquisition could make the Silicon Valley giant a bigger force in cybersecurity, and arrives months after an earlier round of talks collapsed.

item.title: This leader is making AI accessible across the world’s languages
item.description: Sara Hooker runs the nonprofit Cohere for AI.
